ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó ngwòŋ gẅie mepáŋ mé gẅiin menkùɔ mémbʉ́a.
en: Woe to the land of buzzing insect wings

ngiemboon: É túm memántúm pɔ́ lɔgɔ kanúʼu mengʉngʉ́ŋ, ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ tàʼ ntse Nílè!
Pi metsèm pie pi tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó;
en: All you inhabitants of the world

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́ mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn né mèŋ ngie:
en: For the Lord said to me:

ngiemboon: É gwaa lag púʼu, mbà metÿǒ melùʼ ka vɔg sɔɔn,
en: For before the harvest, when the blossoming is over

ngiemboon: Mé ge gÿo kyé pʉ̀a Etíyopìa,
en: They will all be left for the birds of prey on the hills

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mé lɔg shúm pwɔʼ ńtó ńnáa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Esɔɔn shúm, e fóo mbwó pʉ̀a pie é gaʼ, akùbo nnɛ́ yɔ́b piŋ sí. É pʉ̀a yɔɔn láʼ pie é gÿo mé pɔ́gɔ wɔ́b jʉʼɔɔn, mbɔɔ jʉʼ ntsèm, é pɔɔn mentʉ̀ pʉ̀a pie é gwɔʼɔ megàŋmbù pɔ́b, ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie memí cʉa wó. Mé ge gÿo lɔg sɔɔn shúm, é tóo, é náa ndùm lekwɛ́ Siyoŋ, á jʉʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, à tsẅe wó.
en: At that time a gift will be brought to the Lord of Armies from   a people tall and smooth-skinned,  # 18:7 Ps 68:31; Is 45:14; Zph 3:10; Ac 8:27–38 a people feared far and near, a powerful nation with a strange language, whose land is divided by rivers #— #to Mount Zion, the place of the name of the Lord of Armies.
